page.title: 06EDUCATION - CROSSHILL
page.content: Crosshill Primary School,of semi-open plan design,was opened in January 1978.It has 3 classrooms which are carpeted,its own modern kitchen from which approx.30 school dinners are served daily,and has oil-fired central heating.The staff consists of 3 teachers,one of whom is Head Teacher, 2 specialist teachers,1 part-time clerical/auxiliary,1 janitor/cleaner, 1 cook and a part-time assistant. There are 62 pupils between the ages of 5 and 12 years on the roll which is decreasing annually.At the age of 12 years pupils transfer to Carrick Academy,Maybole.Teaching aids include computer,projectors,radio and colour television.Subjects taught include English,Arithmetic and Maths,P.E. Art, Religious Education and Environmental Studies i.e.History,Geography,Science and Health Education.
